title: Mum 'petrified' as Ryanair seat 'falls apart' on flight from Manchester to Spain
text:

A mum-of-five said she was petrified as the seat she was sitting on fell apart on a Ryanair flight to Girona in Spain.

Leann Wilkinson was leaving for a week away in Lloret de Mar, with family and friends, when she says the incident took place.

The 42 year old claims she was only part way through the two hour flight when she realised her seat appeared to be moving, Hull Live reports.

She was travelling with three of her children, Tyler, 18, Kionie-Aleisha, 14, and Mia-Sydnie, 12, and asked them if they were having similar problems.

"I asked my kids if their seats were reclining," she said. "I was petrified, I daren't move.

(Image: Hull Live WS)

"I didn't even get up when the seat belt lights went off."

Her flight had left Manchester Airport at 8.35am on Tuesday, October 1.

She said it was only once the plane had landed that she felt safe to get up and have a proper look at the seat.

"When I was leaving the flight I checked the seat and the bottom just fell off," she said.

"It just fell away as everyone was trying to disembark. There were people trying to keep on moving but I didn't care."

She took a picture of the broken seat before leaving the plane.

She said the incident had made her wary of flying especially for her return flight, a week later.

"I was hoping it wouldn't be the same plane on the way back, because I just wouldn't have sat there," she said.

"I mean it's not like a bus breaking down is it? You can't just get off.

"It was very, very frightening.

"I'm going on a 13-hour flight to Thailand in May and I know it's a different airline but I'm dreading it."

Leann emailed Ryanair with her complaint when she got back to the UK and was told that all their planes are checked the night before they fly.

In their response to her complaint, a representative from Ryanair said: "We carry out daily audits on each of our aircraft to ensure that all furnishings and equipment are in perfect working order.

"Any defects noted are repaired that night.

"Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention, we hope that this does not deter you from choosing Ryanair for your future flights."

Ryanair has been approached for comment.
description: Leann Wilkinson was flying from Manchester Airport to Girona in Spain on the low cost airline
